newsitem.title: CHILE: Chilean shares close stable as calm returns.
newsitem.headline: Chilean shares close stable as calm returns.

text.p: Chilean shares closed slightly lower in moderate trade on Tuesday with investors breathing a sigh of relief after the volatility in recent sessions, dealers said.
"Chile is fortunately achieving some degree of independence from Wall Street," said Guillermo Tagle, head of research at Santander Investments.
Trading at the opening is expected to continue steady, provided there is no untoward macro-economic news or surprise movement in New York, said dealers.
The 40-share index closed down 0.04 percent at 113.58 points. The general index shed 0.07 percent to 5,274.53 points.
Turnover was a moderate 10.7 billion pesos.
Traders said the market did not react to news that consumer prices rose 0.3 percent in March, as the figure was in line with analysts expectations.
Gainers included forestry firm Masisa which climbed on hopes the firm will show an improvement in its earnings this year, said Tagle.
Masisa ended up 4.19 percent at 220 pesos.
Other winners included pension fund manager Habitat, up 5.12 percent at 77 pesos and power utility Chilgener which firmed 1.7 percent at 2,690 pesos.
Losers included winery Emiliana, down 12.31 percent at 57 pesos and investment company Oro Blanco which shed 3.43 percent to 2.25 pesos.
